title: Islamic Nato? Why Saudi-Pak defence pact changes everything - for India and Israel
description: Saudi Arabia and Pakistan have solidified their alliance with a strategic mutual defense agreement, treating an attack on one as an attack on both. This pact, signed amidst regional tensions following an Israeli airstrike in Doha, signals a shift in Saudi Arabia's reliance on US security guarantees.

title: Iran's Chabahar Port in trouble: US revokes sanctions exemption; big impact on India
description: The US revocation of sanctions exemptions for Chabahar Port poses challenges to India's regional connectivity plans. This move threatens Indian investments and operations, complicating its strategic balance between the US and Iran. The port is vital for trade with Afghanistan and Central Asia, serving as a counterweight to China's influence.

title: US in ferment over free speech after late-night comic is shut down
'We want Bagram back': Trump says US will reclaim Afghan airbase; targets China
description: Donald Trump announced plans to "get back" Bagram Airbase in Afghanistan, citing China's growing influence. Trump emphasized the base's strategic value due to its proximity to China's nuclear facilities, only an hour away. Bagram, a key US military asset for two decades, allowed power projection across South and Central Asia.

title: Young sensation! Injuries to breakthrough: Sachin Yadav’s javelin career hits new peak
description: Sachin Yadav, a World Athletics Championships debutant, stunned with a personal best of 86.27m in the men's javelin final in Tokyo, securing fourth place. Yadav outshone seasoned athletes, including Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem and compatriot Neeraj Chopra. His impressive throw kept him in medal contention, marking a significant milestone in his career after overcoming past injuries and setbacks.

title: US citizenship process update: USCIS unveils new test; applicants face stricter rules
description: USCIS is set to implement a new naturalization civics test in 2025, aiming to assess immigrants' understanding of US history and government. This is part of an effort to reinforce the integrity of the naturalization process. Stricter rules, including tougher reviews and neighborhood investigations, are also being rolled out to ensure eligibility and good moral character.

title: Albania AI minister: Virtual avatar 'Diella' delivers first speech in parliament
description: Albania has unveiled Diella, its pioneering AI 'minister,' to parliament, championed by Prime Minister Edi Rama as a symbol of transparency and innovation. Dressed in traditional attire, Diella aims to combat corruption in public spending.

title: Revealed! The hidden injury that shattered Neeraj Chopra's medal dream
description: Neeraj Chopra, battling a back injury sustained during training in the Czech Republic, finished a disappointing eighth at the World Championships final in Tokyo. The injury, which occurred on September 4th, hampered his training and affected his performance. Despite the setback, compatriot Sachin Yadav impressed, securing fourth place with a personal best, highlighting India's growing strength in javelin.

title: Tech Prosperity Deal: Trump’s funny moment with Nvidia CEO; signs AI pact with UK PM
description: During a state visit to Britain, President Trump acknowledged AI's growing influence while signing a "Tech Prosperity Deal" with Prime Minister Starmer. The agreement aims to enhance US-UK collaboration in AI, quantum computing, and nuclear projects. Tech giants like Nvidia, Google, and Microsoft pledged billions in UK investments, with Nvidia's CEO forecasting Britain's rise as an AI superpower.

title: US citizenship: Naturalisation test to be more rigorous - what are the changes
Rahul vs EC Round 2: Cong's new attack fact-checked by EC; BJP mocks claims
description: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Chief Election Commissioner of shielding “vote chors” and obstructing investigations into voter deletions, presenting alleged proof of manipulation in Karnataka's Aland constituency. The BJP has dismissed these claims as lies, while the Election Commission has refuted them, stating that deletions cannot be done online.

title: Saudi Arabia visa for Indians: Types, eligibility, fees, documents & more
description: Saudi Arabia now offers Indian travellers multiple visa options, including e-visas and visa-on-arrival under specific conditions. With mandatory travel insurance and clearly defined eligibility, the process is streamlined but varies by visa type. This guide covers general requirements, documentation, fees, and application steps to help Indian citizens navigate their Saudi visa process with clarity and confidence.

title: Elon Musk's 48-hour ultimatum: xAI staff must justify jobs; layoffs continue
description: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight two-day deadline. This demand comes amidst ongoing turbulence at the AI company, including recent layoffs in the data annotation team and plans to hire specialized AI tutors. Musk's request mirrors his past practices of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: India-US trade war: Trump may cut 25% penalty tariff soon - what CEA said
description: Chief Economic Advisor anticipates the resolution of the tariff dispute between India and the United States by the end of November, expecting a reduction in tariffs. India's economy continues its growth trajectory, with a projected second-quarter GDP growth of around 7%.

title: Delhi Zoo’s only African elephant Shankar dies: Concerns after WAZA suspension; probe ordered
US Fed rate cut: How does it impact mortgages, credit card interest? Explained
description: The US Federal Reserve has cut interest rates for the first time in nine months, reducing the short-term rate to around 4.1%. This decision, influenced by slow progress on inflation and a weakening job market, aims to address the dual challenge of high prices and difficult employment conditions.

title: Report: Taylor Swift distressed by Kelce’s reaction to Chiefs loss
description: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about the intense public scrutiny affecting her fiancé, Travis Kelce. During a recent NFL game, Kelce's on-field frustration became headline news after he dropped a crucial pass. Sources reveal that the pressure of being linked to Swift has magnified every move Kelce makes, leading to unprecedented levels of attention.

title: Luka Doncic: 'I don't think so,' no plans to follow LeBron
description: LeBron James gears up for his 23rd NBA season with the Los Angeles Lakers, joined by Luka Doncic, who's entering his 8th season. While James aims for another championship, potentially his last, Doncic clarifies he doesn't plan to play as long as his veteran teammate.

title: Karrueche Tran dances with Deion Sanders' baby grandson in sweet clip
description: Amidst uncertainties surrounding Deion Sanders' coaching career, his personal life thrives as actress Karrueche Tran, his rumored girlfriend, shares heartwarming moments with his grandson. Tran's presence has been a constant support for Sanders, and her career continues to flourish, marked by Emmy wins and brand partnerships. Their bond brings balance to Sanders' life amidst on-field challenges.

title: Neeraj Chopra rips off belt; covers face after final elimination - watch
description: Neeraj Chopra finished eighth in the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships. His best throw was 84.03m. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold. Anderson Peters secured silver, and Curtis Thompson took bronze. Sachin Yadav of India finished fourth with a personal best. Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan ended in tenth place.

title: Close call: AI Express flight makes emergency landing; suspected bird hit
Kuldeep Yadav on facing Pakistan: 'It's just a batter in front of you'
description: Team India has secured its spot in the Asia Cup 2025 Super Four after defeating UAE and Pakistan. The India-Pakistan match was marred by a handshake controversy. Spinner Kuldeep Yadav, unfazed by the off-field drama, is focused on the upcoming matches. He emphasized his good rhythm and the favorable conditions for spinners.

title: Air India crash: Victims' kin sue Boeing, Honeywell; blame fuel cutoff switches
description: Families of Air India Flight AI171 crash victims are suing Boeing and Honeywell, alleging faulty fuel switches caused the disaster. The lawsuit claims the switches' design led to accidental activation, cutting engine power shortly after takeoff. Despite meeting regulatory requirements, the switches' placement is questioned, though experts deem accidental activation unlikely.

title: Will Tua Tagovailoa play? -Dolphins QB injury update — facing Bills tonight
description: Tua Tagovailoa will suit up for the Miami Dolphins against the Buffalo Bills on Thursday Night Football. Despite a rough 0-2 start and questions about his form, the Dolphins QB takes the field in Week 3. Here’s the latest on his status, game details, and what it means for Miami’s season.

title: Elon Musk outlines Mars colony plan: Starship key; settlement by 2055
description: Elon Musk envisions a self-sustaining Mars settlement within 30 years, hinging on SpaceX's Starship and its heavy-lift capabilities. Success depends on increasing cargo tonnage per launch window, enabling settlers to establish independent infrastructure. Overcoming Starship's reusability challenges, particularly the heat shield, is crucial for cost-effective colonization and achieving planetary redundancy.

title: Online gaming regulation: New rules to take effect from October 1
description: New online gaming regulations are set to be implemented from October 1st, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The government has engaged in extensive discussions with stakeholders, including gaming companies and banks, to finalize the rules. The legislation aims to promote e-sports while banning harmful money-based gaming and associated financial activities, with penalties targeting providers and promoters rather than players.

title: Who is Sachin Yadav? Indian javelin throw star who outshone Neeraj Chopra
description: Sachin Yadav, the Indian javelin thrower, made a significant impact at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, securing fourth place with a personal best of 86.27 metres. He surpassed expectations by outperforming prominent Asian competitors Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem.

title: Jimmy Kimmel 'cancelled' - comical or tragic?
description: Today, Trump and MAGA sing the same hymn. The very people who raged against cancel culture now practise it with missionary zeal. Academics, nurses, and journalists who mocked Kirk’s death have been punished into silence. The chorus hasn’t changed — only the choir.

title: ‘Beaten to death with baseball bat’: Inside the grisly murder of 71-year-old NRI
description: In a shocking incident near Ludhiana, NRI Rupinder Kaur was allegedly murdered by Sukhjit Singh, at the behest of Charanjit Singh, residing in UK. Rupinder was killed to prevent her from filing a case against Charanjit after he backed out of marriage. Sukhjit allegedly bludgeoned her, burnt the body, and disposed of the remains in a canal.

title: Exclusive | Handshake row: PCB's emails to ICC, closed door meeting & Pycroft's non apology
description: Amidst uncertainty surrounding Pakistan's Asia Cup participation, the PCB demanded match referee Andy Pycroft's removal, alleging code of conduct violations during the India-Pakistan match, specifically regarding the captains not shaking hands. Despite PCB's threats, the ICC stood firm, asserting Pycroft followed ACC instructions and didn't violate any rules.

title: Revealed! The hidden injury that shattered Neeraj Chopra's medal dream
description: Neeraj Chopra, battling a back injury sustained during training in the Czech Republic, finished a disappointing eighth at the World Championships final in Tokyo. The injury, which occurred on September 4th, hampered his training and affected his performance. Despite the setback, compatriot Sachin Yadav impressed, securing fourth place with a personal best, highlighting India's growing strength in javelin.

title: Asia Cup LIVE: Nabi's 60 off 22 balls guides Afghanistan to 169/8 vs Sri Lanka
'It's just a batter in front of you': Kuldeep Yadav on facing Pakistan
description: Team India has secured its spot in the Asia Cup 2025 Super Four after defeating UAE and Pakistan. The India-Pakistan match was marred by a handshake controversy. Spinner Kuldeep Yadav, unfazed by the off-field drama, is focused on the upcoming matches. He emphasized his good rhythm and the favorable conditions for spinners.

title: “Congress has a duty”: Rep. James Comer calls Discord, Reddit, Twitch and Steam CEOs to testify on radicalization
description: James Comer will investigate online platforms' role in radicalization. He has summoned CEOs of Discord, Reddit, Twitch, and Steam to testify. The hearing is scheduled for October 8, 2025. It follows Charlie Kirk's assassination, possibly linked to online forums. Comer aims to prevent platforms' exploitation for extremist purposes. The committee will identify warning signs and business models facilitating harmful behavior.

title: Khalil Ibrahim Net Worth in 2025: How Al-Dhafra Star Built His Fortune In UAE football
description: Khalil Ibrahim, born in Abu Dhabi, is a key winger for Al-Dhafra FC since August 2024, contracted until June 2027. Wearing jersey number 10, he boasts over 190 UAE Pro League matches with 30+ goals. Since 2019, he has represented the UAE national team in over 21 appearances, scoring 4 goals, showcasing his commitment to his nation.

title: World Athletics Championships: Neeraj Chopra finishes eighth in javelin throw final; Sachin Yadav fourth
description: Neeraj Chopra's quest for another World Athletics Championships medal fell short as he finished eighth in the men's javelin final, a stark contrast to his previous triumph at the same venue. Keshorn Walcott secured the gold, while Anderson Peters took silver, and Curtis Thompson claimed bronze. Sachin Yadav of India narrowly missed the podium, finishing fourth.

title: Ismail Abdullatif Networth 2025: Football Income, business ventures and more
description: Ismail Abdullatif is a famous footballer from Bahrain. He plays for Al-Khalidiya. People are curious about his net worth in 2025. Public data about his exact earnings is unavailable. He has played for several clubs. His market value is around €50,000. Details about his business deals are also scarce. Any claims about his wealth are speculative.

title: Shubham Ranjane: The Mumbai boy living his cricket dream in the US
description: Shubham Ranjane, carrying forward a three-generation cricketing legacy, transitioned from Mumbai's competitive cricket scene to Major League Cricket in the USA. Inspired by his grandfather, a former India Test player, and his father, who represented India A, Shubham aims for the IPL and the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: Shock in Tokyo! Neeraj Chopra's incredible 26-podium streak broken
description: Neeraj Chopra's impressive streak of podium finishes ended at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, where he finished eighth with a best throw of 84.03m. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold, while India's Sachin Yadav narrowly missed a medal, finishing fourth. Despite the setback, hopes remain high for Chopra's future performances.

title: From injuries to breakthrough: Sachin Yadav’s javelin career hits new peak in Tokyo
description: Sachin Yadav, a World Athletics Championships debutant, stunned with a personal best of 86.27m in the men's javelin final in Tokyo, securing fourth place. Yadav outshone seasoned athletes, including Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem and compatriot Neeraj Chopra. His impressive throw kept him in medal contention, marking a significant milestone in his career after overcoming past injuries and setbacks.

title: Fact check: Did match referee Andy Pycroft apologise to Pakistan?
description: Pakistan threatened to withdraw from the Asia Cup after a perceived slight during the India-Pakistan match, claiming that India captain Suryakumar Yadav refused to shake hands with Pakistani counterpart Salman Ali Agha. The Pakistan Cricket Board said match referee Andy Pycroft apologised for miscommunication. But did he? We fact check that claim.

title: R Ashwin to play for Team India once again, but there’s a twist!
description: Veteran off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin is set to represent Team India at the Hong Kong Sixes 2025, marking his first appearance since calling time on his IPL career and departing from Chennai Super Kings. Ashwin expressed his excitement to participate in the fast-paced format, anticipating a challenging competition against quality players.

title: India unveils striking medals for World Para Athletics Championships New Delhi
description: The Paralympic Committee of India (PCI) revealed the official medals for the New Delhi 2025 World Para Athletics Championships, a historic event set to host over 2,200 athletes from across 104 nations. The medals blend Indian cultural motifs with inclusivity and sporting achievement, featuring Braille and a striking blue ribbon.

title: Neeraj Chopra rips off belt, covers face after elimination in final - watch
description: Neeraj Chopra finished eighth in the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships. His best throw was 84.03m. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold. Anderson Peters secured silver, and Curtis Thompson took bronze. Sachin Yadav of India finished fourth with a personal best. Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan ended in tenth place.

title: Golf champion Rory McIlroy set for a big return at the 2026 Hero Dubai Desert Classic: How to get your tickets
description: Rory McIlroy is returning to the Hero Dubai Desert Classic in January 2026, chasing a record fifth title after a career-defining Grand Slam win. Set at Emirates Golf Club, the event promises top-tier golf, family-friendly fun, and a prize pool over AED 33 million. Tickets are out now, with free entry on select days and early bird deals.

title: Strange! 'Nobody buys a ticket to see Virat Kohli ... ': Former World Cup winner
description: Balvinder Singh Sandhu proposes that the BCCI should consider using specialist fielders in domestic cricket and the IPL to manage the workload of senior players like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Jasprit Bumrah. He argues that excessive fielding puts unnecessary strain on these key players, potentially shortening their careers. "Why kill the goose that lays the golden egg?” he wrote in his Mid-Day column.

title: Pakistan cricket faces a fresh storm — corruption row over players' jerseys explodes
description: Former Atiq-uz-Zaman criticised the PCB for providing substandard jerseys during the Asia Cup 2025, contrasting them with the dry-fit kits of other teams. Despite Pakistan's Super Four qualification after defeating UAE, Captain Salman Ali Agha acknowledged batting concerns, particularly in the middle overs. Agha emphasised the need for improvement before their crucial match against India on September 21.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Handshake row: PCB's emails to ICC, closed door meeting & Pycroft's non apology
description: Amidst uncertainty surrounding Pakistan's Asia Cup participation, the PCB demanded match referee Andy Pycroft's removal, alleging code of conduct violations during the India-Pakistan match, specifically regarding the captains not shaking hands. Despite PCB's threats, the ICC stood firm, asserting Pycroft followed ACC instructions and didn't violate any rules.

title: Shreyas Iyer's Test comeback dreams take a hit — falls for single digits
description: Shreyas Iyer's struggles continued as he scored only eight runs in the unofficial Test against Australia A, further jeopardizing his chances for a Test comeback. Australia A posted a formidable 532/6 declared, highlighted by centuries from Sam Konstas and Josh Phillippe. India A's innings saw contributions from Abhimanyu Easwaran and Sai Sudharsan, but Iyer's performance remained a concern.

title: Players forced to strip down to shorts as AC malfunctions - watch
description: AS Monaco's Champions League travel plans faced disruption when their charter flight experienced an air conditioning malfunction at Nice airport. Players were left stranded in sweltering conditions, leading to significant discomfort and the postponement of their trip to Belgium. Despite the setback, coach Adi Hütter affirmed the team's commitment to preparing for their match against Club Brugge.
